data.title: Watch Arizona Colt
data.meta_description: Watch Arizona Colt Online. Arizona Colt the 1966 Movie, Trailers, Videos and more at Yidio.
data.text:
Arizona Colt is a western movie released in 1966 and directed by Michele Lupo. It stars Giuliano Gemma as the titular character, Fernando Sancho as El Paso, and Corinne Marchand as Jane. The plot of the movie revolves around Arizona Colt, a notorious outlaw who is falsely accused of stealing a bank's safe. As he tries to clear his name, he runs into El Paso, a notorious bandit who is also on the run from the law. Together, they come across Jane, a beautiful woman who is looking for her husband's killer. If they work together, they just might be able to get what they want.

The movie is set in the American Old West, a time of cowboys, saloons, outlaws, and horses. The setting is perfect for a western movie, and the filmmakers do an excellent job of portraying the era's atmosphere. The costumes, sets, and landscapes are incredibly well done, transporting the audience to the heart of the Wild West.

Arizona Colt is a character with flaws, but he's also likable, charming, and charismatic. Giuliano Gemma portrays him perfectly, displaying the right amount of toughness and vulnerability. He's a skilled gunslinger with a sharp wit, but he's also human and struggles with his past. It makes him relatable and someone you root for throughout the film.

Fernando Sancho's El Paso serves as the film's comic relief, and he's great at it. He's a bumbling bandit who's always getting into trouble, but he's also resourceful and able to get out of it. The scenes between him and Arizona Colt are some of the movie's best, as they play off each other well.

Corinne Marchand is undoubtedly a highlight of the movie. She portrays Jane as a strong, independent woman determined to find her husband's killer. She's not just a damsel in distress waiting for her hero to save her. She holds her own and can even outsmart Arizona Colt at times. Her character is a refreshing change from the typical female roles in western movies of the time.

The movie's action sequences are well done, with several shootouts and horse chases. The gunfights are staged and choreographed expertly, with an emphasis on realism rather than stylization. The sound effects are also impressive and enhance the excitement of the scenes. The stunts are top-notch, with the performers doing their own horse-riding and gun-slinging.

Arizona Colt's music is memorable and adds to the movie's overall experience. It's a mixture of traditional western music and a few Italian melodies. The film's score is composed by Francesco De Masi, who used a 70-piece orchestra to create a lush and dramatic soundtrack that perfectly complements the action on screen.

The movie contains some elements of humor, which sets it apart from other westerns of the time. While it doesn't detract from the seriousness of the story, it adds a lightness and fun that makes the film enjoyable to watch. The comedy is mostly situational, and the characters' interaction is witty and clever.

In conclusion, Arizona Colt is a must-see for western movie lovers. It's a well-made film with excellent performances, especially from Giuliano Gemma and Corinne Marchand. The action sequences are exciting, and the movie's humor makes it stand out from other westerns. The movie's setting, costumes, and music give it a classic feel that is rare to find in modern films. It's a timeless classic and a tribute to the western genre.

Arizona Colt is a 1966 western with a runtime of 1 hour and 58 minutes. It has received moderate reviews from critics and viewers, who have given it an IMDb score of 6.1.
